author.name: Guillemette de Ventadour
author.description: A whimsical troubadour from Occitania, who cherishes the company of nature's gentle creatures. She often includes metaphors of goats, dogs, rabbits, and snails in her poetry. Her writing style is terse.

newsMedieval:
In lands afar, the dollar gains,
As labor thrives, the Fed attains,
Yet wages slow and jobless rise,
In June, a pause may make them wise.

'Neath olive groves, Greek bonds bring cheer,
With German's kin, they draw tightly near,
Twenty points more, for tightening race,
Bank of America sings its grace.

A snail traverses, on shares downbeat,
Rio Tinto's path on copper's street,
Deutsche Bank's wisdom, they value find,
Six-thousand two, their favor's shined.

feedItems.title: Dollar Boosted by Strong US Jobs Data
feedItems.description: The dollar rose following the jobs data, as strong employment growth will “keep pressure on the Fed to keep raising rates,” although a higher unemployment rate and slightly slower wage growth could lead to a slower pace of rate rises and potentially a pause in June, MUFG said.

feedItems.title: Greek-German Bond Yield Spread Could Tighten Further
feedItems.description: Greek government bonds had a decent run tightening versus German bonds as well as other peripheral peers since 2022 but a series of short-term indicators hint there may be space for another 20 basis points, Bank of America said.

feedItems.title: Rio Tinto Shares Are Undervalued
feedItems.description: Rio Tinto shares are down more than 20% year-to-date, making them attractively undervalued given the company’s high quality, cash generative business, Deutsche Bank said, lifting its rating to buy and its target price to 6,200 pence.

author.name: Conchobar mac Dubhthach
author.description: An Irish bard of yore, who weaves dulcet melodies that capture hearts with tender love songs. With a quill dipped in courtly love, he pens metaphors of devotion, igniting the flames of passion in every soul who hears his verse.

newsMedieval:
In early London, a tale of woe unfolds,
As metal prices slip and all behold,
Where dollar strength hath made its presence seen,
Macroeconomic weakness plays its scene.

Yet oil doth rise, a valiant tale retold,
Of Saudi's choice to cut, a tale bold,
A million barrels less, they choose to share,
So cometh forth, provision's price doth dare.

And now in European realms we see,
The price of oil doth leap, in triumph be,
For Saudi's tale of cuts hath found its stance,
O'er futures they command, with joys they dance.

feedItems.title: Metal Prices Slip Amid Dollar Strength
feedItems.description: Base metals and gold prices were falling in early London trade, despite other commodities like oil rising, as dollar strength and macroeconomic weakness continued to pressure indexes.

feedItems.title: Oil Gains After Saudi Arabia Goes It Alone With Oil Cuts
feedItems.description: Oil prices rose about 2% in Europe after Saudi Arabia said it would unilaterally slash output by 1 million barrels a day.

feedItems.title: Oil Prices Jump After Saudi Output Cut
feedItems.description: Crude oil futures opened higher after Saudi Arabia said that it was cutting production on top of OPEC+ reductions.

author.name: Æthelred the Skald
author.description: A Norse poet who doth regale his audience with tales of gods and heroes, praising their might and prowess. He references Norse mythology and history in his poems. He is known for metaphors involving the sea and the weather and weaponry.

newsMedieval:
Of giants and titans in Eastern realm,
Their hopes did lie on foreign shore,
To feast in wealth, a China's boom they sought,
Alas, for many, the spoils were naught.

In lands Germanic, of trade and might,
An April wind blew surplus bright,
Exportation, to great a height it soared,
In foreign hunger, German wares adored.

Now, hear of UBS, a saga grand,
To merge with Credit Suisse, take its hand,
Their union swift, as skalds foretold,
With shares delisted, stories bold.

feedItems.title: Big American Companies Wonder: When Will China Bounce Back?
feedItems.description: Big American companies in China were counting on a postpandemic boom to boost global revenue. For many, it isn’t happening.

feedItems.title: Germany's Trade Surplus Climbs
feedItems.description: Germany’s trade surplus rose to €18.4 billion in April, as exports ticked up 1.2% on month, beating expectations, a sign of increased foreign demand for German goods.

feedItems.title: UBS to Close Credit Suisse Takeover as Early as Next Week
feedItems.description: UBS Group said it expects to complete its acquisition of Credit Suisse Group and have the shares of the Swiss peer delisted as early as next week.

author.name: Brother Arnulfus
author.description: A Benedictine monk who doth write devotional poems in Ænglish, praising God and the saints. His poems are often humorous, short, and satirical. They often contain metaphors of alcohol, especially wine or ale.

newsMedieval:
When wŷves and Maidens taketh "Me Time" brûne,
To soothē their swathëd hearts with joy and húwe,
As drēadful nēds doth cease in Summer's tún,
Methinks, thêy learen from their men sa fûne.

Ægains the Russes in their Belgorod town,
Ukraïne trôops have bréach'd the border's wȳne,
Twô soldiers caught by brave and boldest hands,
Týdeth with wéakness swift ōn Russèd lands.

México's populous citizens did find,
A governor enthronëd, þe oppôse be sháme,
In that vast státe, which hath becomēn bright,
Ruĉóȳng out òppoſítion's former blight.

feedItems.title: What Women Can Learn From Men About 'Me Time'
feedItems.description: This summer, make more space in your life for the fun stuff.

feedItems.title: A fresh incursion into Russia's Belgorod region by Ukraine-backed troops who said they seized territory and captured two Russian soldiers added to signs of vulnerability in Russia's defenses within its borders.
feedItems.description: A fresh incursion into Russia’s Belgorod region by Ukraine-backed troops who said they seized territory and captured two Russian soldiers added to signs of vulnerability in Russia’s defenses within its borders.

feedItems.title: Mexico's ruling party won the governorship in the country's most populous state, which has been a stronghold for the opposition.
feedItems.description: Mexico’s ruling party won the governorship in the country’s most populous state, which has been a stronghold for the opposition.
